properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 11:45AM CST by NWS Jackson MS
properties.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in
Mississippi..

Pearl River Near Rockport affecting Copiah and Simpson Counties
Pearl River Near Monticello affecting Lawrence County
Pearl River Near Columbia affecting Marion County

The Flood Warning continues for
The Pearl River Near Rockport
* until further notice.
* At 10:30 AM Tuesday the stage was 36.7 feet.
* Moderate flooding is occurring and Moderate flooding is forecast.
* Flood stage is 25.0 feet.
* Forecast...Forty eight hours of rainfall has been added to the forecast.
The added rainfall will now produce a crest near 38.0 feet
on Thursday evening.
* Flood history...This crest exceeds the 37.4 foot crest which occurred
on Dec 23 1961.
* Impact...At 38.0 feet...the river approaches homes in the Rockport
area.
* Impact...At 37.0 feet...flood water will block off many local
access roads near Rockport road. Tree farm south of Rockport Road
near the bend is beginning to flood on Copiah side of the river.
* Impact...At 38.0 feet...the river approaches homes in the Rockport
area.
properties.instruction:
Do not drive or walk through areas where water covers roadway! The
water may be deeper than it appears. Remember...Turn around, don't
drown!

Please note that forecast crests are based upon rainfall that has
occurred along with forecast rainfall for the next 48 hours.

Additional information is available at:
https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=JAN

The next regularly scheduled update is expected tonight between 8 and
10 PM.
